frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs more efficiently proliferation and survival of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs more efficiently proliferation and survival of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell lines when compared to isoform-selective PI3K inhibitorsClass I phosphatidylinositol 3-kinases (PI3Ks) are frequently activated in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL), mainly due to the loss of PTEN function.

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs more efficiently proliferation
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs more efficiently proliferation and survival of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell lines when compared to isoform-selective PI3K inhibitorsClass I phosphatidylinositol 3-kinases (PI3Ks) are frequently activated in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL), mainly due to the loss of PTEN function.

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition suppressed Akt
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition suppressed Akt activation and induced caspase-independent apoptosis.

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition suppressed Akt activation and induced caspase-independent apoptosis
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition suppressed Akt activation and induced caspase-independent apoptosis.

frames.text: phosphorylation of phosphatidylinositol-4
frames.verbose-text: Our findings strongly support clinical application of class I PI3K pan-inhibitors in T-ALL treatment, with the possible exception of ETP-ALL cases.INTRODUCTIONClass I phosphatidylinositol 3-kinases (PI3Ks) comprise members of a conserved family of heterodimeric intracellular lipid kinases involved in crucial aspects of cell growth and survival through phosphorylation of phosphatidylinositol-4, 5-bisphosphate (PIP2) to phosphatidylinositol-3, 4, 5-trisphosphate (PIP3) which acts as an intracellular second messenger by binding with high affinity to pleckstrin homology (PH) domains in target molecules [1].

frames.text: phosphorylate and activate Akt
frames.verbose-text: Recruitment to the plasma membrane brings these two proteins in close proximity, allowing PDK1 to phosphorylate and activate Akt which in turn phosphorylates target proteins affecting cell growth, cell cycle progression, and cell survival [2].

frames.text: phosphatase PTEN (phosphatase and tensin homolog deleted on chromosome 10) which prevents the accumulation of PIP3
frames.verbose-text: The activation of the PI3K pathway is controlled by the 3â€²-phosphate lipid phosphatase PTEN (phosphatase and tensin homolog deleted on chromosome 10) which prevents the accumulation of PIP3 converting it back into PIP2 [3].

frames.text: PTEN (phosphatase and tensin homolog deleted on chromosome 10) which prevents the accumulation of PIP3
frames.verbose-text: The activation of the PI3K pathway is controlled by the 3â€²-phosphate lipid phosphatase PTEN (phosphatase and tensin homolog deleted on chromosome 10) which prevents the accumulation of PIP3 converting it back into PIP2 [3].

frames.text: Î´ and p110Î³ isoforms are preferentially expressed
frames.verbose-text: Unlike the ubiquitous p110Î± and p110Î², p110Î´ and p110Î³ isoforms are preferentially expressed in leucocytes [4].

frames.text: ZSTK-474 markedly slowed down the doubling time in Loucy, DND-41, and ALL-SIL cells, whereas a negative doubling time was estimated in Jurkat cells, suggesting cell death
frames.verbose-text: Compared to untreated controls, ZSTK-474 markedly slowed down the doubling time in Loucy, DND-41, and ALL-SIL cells, whereas a negative doubling time was estimated in Jurkat cells, suggesting cell death induction (Fig. 2C).

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs proliferation
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition impairs proliferation in T-ALL cell linesGrowth curves of T-ALL cell lines treated with 5 Î¼M of PI3K selective and pan-inhibitors (A) or with increasing concentration (0.5, 1 and 5 Î¼M) of the dual inhibitor IPI-145 (B).

frames.text: PTEN expression
frames.verbose-text: These results demonstrated that overall PI3K pan-inhibition impaired cell proliferation more efficiently than dual p110Î³/Î´ inhibition.Anti-proliferative effects of PI3K inhibitors are independent from total PIP3 level reductionFirstly, we investigated cell lines with regard to PI3K isoforms and PTEN expression.

frames.verbose-text: Nevertheless, in both of these cell lines, PTEN was phosphorylated at Ser380, which is a marker of PTEN posttranslational inactivation by CK2 and consequent PI3K pathway activation [12, 33].

frames.text: PIP3 levels
frames.verbose-text: To evaluate the impact of the inhibitors on PI3K activity, total PIP3 levels were then quantified by flow cytometry [11].

frames.text: PIP3 levels
frames.verbose-text: Regarding the isoform selective inhibitors, all the compounds induced a decrease in PIP3 levels, suggesting that each PI3K catalytic isoform could contribute to PIP2 phosphorylation in T-ALL cells (Fig. 3B).

frames.text: PIP3 total cellular amount was not fully related to cellular proliferation.PI3K pan-inhibition impairs Akt
frames.verbose-text: However, PIP3 reduction did not fully correlate with the observed anti-proliferative effects induced by the inhibitors.Taken together, these data demonstrated that each isoform can sustain PIP3 synthesis in T-ALL cells, but PIP3 total cellular amount was not fully related to cellular proliferation.PI3K pan-inhibition impairs Akt-mediated signalingWe next examined the effects of the different inhibitors on signaling downstream of PI3K.

frames.text: Akt, which is recruited to the plasma membrane through direct interaction with PIP3 and subsequent phosphorylation on Thr308 by PDK1 and Ser473

arguments.text: Akt, which is recruited to the plasma membrane through direct interaction with PIP3 and subsequent phosphorylation on Thr308 by PDK1 and Ser473

frames.verbose-text: One of the major PI3K targets is the serine/threonine kinase Akt, which is recruited to the plasma membrane through direct interaction with PIP3 and subsequent phosphorylation on Thr308 by PDK1 and Ser473 by mTORC2 for full activation [7].

arguments.text: Akt, which is recruited to the plasma membrane through direct interaction with PIP3 and subsequent phosphorylation on Thr308 by PDK1 and Ser473

frames.verbose-text: One of the major PI3K targets is the serine/threonine kinase Akt, which is recruited to the plasma membrane through direct interaction with PIP3 and subsequent phosphorylation on Thr308 by PDK1 and Ser473 by mTORC2 for full activation [7].

frames.text: phosphorylation of this Akt
frames.verbose-text: In all cell lines, selective p110Î±, âˆ’Î² or âˆ’Î³ inhibition was unable to reduce Akt phosphorylation at Thr308, whereas both p110Î´ and dual p110Î³/Î´ inhibition induced a comparable decrease, suggesting a major role for the p110Î´ isoform in the phosphorylation of this Akt amino acidic residue (Fig. 4A).

frames.text: Akt phosphorylation at Thr308
frames.verbose-text: In all cell lines, selective p110Î±, âˆ’Î² or âˆ’Î³ inhibition was unable to reduce Akt phosphorylation at Thr308, whereas both p110Î´ and dual p110Î³/Î´ inhibition induced a comparable decrease, suggesting a major role for the p110Î´ isoform in the phosphorylation of this Akt amino acidic residue (Fig. 4A).

frames.text: Akt phosphorylated at Ser473
frames.verbose-text: Most importantly, only pan-inhibition induced a significant reduction of Akt phosphorylated at Ser473, either after 6 h (Jurkat, Loucy, and DND-41 cells; Fig. 4A) or 24 h (ALL-SIL cells; Fig. 4B) treatment, suggesting mTORC2 inhibition.

frames.text: p110Î´ inhibitors (AS-605240 and CAL-101) induced the dephosphorylation of the main PI3K
frames.verbose-text: The pan-inhibitor ZSTK-474 and the combination of p110Î³ and p110Î´ inhibitors (AS-605240 and CAL-101) induced the dephosphorylation of the main PI3K downstream targets Akt, P70S6K, and S6RP (A and B) but only ZSTK-474 decreased both the phosphorylated residues of Akt, Thr308 and Ser473.

frames.text: levels of PKC
frames.verbose-text: We observed that neither selective, nor dual or pan-inhibitors reduced phosphorylated levels of PKC isoforms [34].

frames.text: PI3K activity mainly inhibited Akt and its downstream targets.Anti-proliferative activity of PI3K pan-inhibition acts through cell cycle arrest and caspase-independent apoptosisSince PI3K/Akt signaling
frames.verbose-text: Therefore, block of PI3K activity mainly inhibited Akt and its downstream targets.Anti-proliferative activity of PI3K pan-inhibition acts through cell cycle arrest and caspase-independent apoptosisSince PI3K/Akt signaling controls different cellular pathways, we examined the inhibitor effects on cell cycle and induction of apoptosis.

frames.text: IPI-145 did not perturb the cell cycle
frames.verbose-text: The dual inhibitor IPI-145 did not perturb the cell cycle of the Loucy cell line.

frames.text: PI3K inhibition did not induce caspase-3
frames.verbose-text: (C) Western blotting documented that PI3K inhibition did not induce caspase-3 activation.

frames.text: caspases did not contribute to cell death
frames.verbose-text: Moreover, western blot analysis demonstrated the absence of cleaved effector caspase 3 both at 24 and 48 h of treatment with the inhibitors (Fig. 5C and data not shown) suggesting that caspases did not contribute to cell death.

frames.text: cell cycle arrest in G0/G1 cell phase but only pan-inhibition was able to efficiently induce cell death
frames.verbose-text: As presented in Fig. 5D, cell death induced by pan-inhibition was not affected by caspase inhibition.Overall, these results demonstrated that PI3K inhibition caused cell cycle arrest in G0/G1 cell phase but only pan-inhibition was able to efficiently induce cell death with a caspase-independent mechanism.Autophagy is a protective mechanism against PI3K pan-inhibitionAutophagy is a homeostatic cellular process which regulates protein and organelle turnover through their lysosomal destruction [35].

frames.text: expression of LC3B I/II
frames.verbose-text: To analyze possible autophagy induction, we investigated the expression of LC3B I/II, a recognized autophagy marker [37].

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition with ZTK-474 treatment induced a considerable percentage of cell death
frames.verbose-text: Because PI3K pan-inhibition with ZTK-474 treatment induced a considerable percentage of cell death in Jurkat cells compared to the other cell lines, we supposed a protective role of autophagy in this context.

frames.text: expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1, MAP1LC3B
frames.verbose-text: In particular, in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cells, PI3K pan-inhibition increased the expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1, MAP1LC3B, and ATG16L2, all involved in autophagic vesicle nucleation and expansion, as well as increased expression of genes involved in autophagy induction and regulation (INS, PIK3C) or prosurvival genes (BCL2, EIF2AK3).

frames.text: expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2
frames.verbose-text: In particular, in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cells, PI3K pan-inhibition increased the expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1, MAP1LC3B, and ATG16L2, all involved in autophagic vesicle nucleation and expansion, as well as increased expression of genes involved in autophagy induction and regulation (INS, PIK3C) or prosurvival genes (BCL2, EIF2AK3).

frames.text: expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1
frames.verbose-text: In particular, in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cells, PI3K pan-inhibition increased the expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1, MAP1LC3B, and ATG16L2, all involved in autophagic vesicle nucleation and expansion, as well as increased expression of genes involved in autophagy induction and regulation (INS, PIK3C) or prosurvival genes (BCL2, EIF2AK3).

frames.text: expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1
frames.verbose-text: In particular, in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cells, PI3K pan-inhibition increased the expression of DRAM1, GABARAPL1, GABARAPL2, WIPI1, MAP1LC3B, and ATG16L2, all involved in autophagic vesicle nucleation and expansion, as well as increased expression of genes involved in autophagy induction and regulation (INS, PIK3C) or prosurvival genes (BCL2, EIF2AK3).

frames.text: expression of the tumor suppressor gene CDKN1B
frames.verbose-text: However, we observed a > 2 fold change in expression of the tumor suppressor gene CDKN1B, as well as in CTSS (cathepsin S) gene.

frames.text: levels of cathepsin S
frames.verbose-text: Interestingly, low levels of cathepsin S or its pharmacological inhibition have been related to the induction of autophagy in cancer cells [38, 39].

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition induces autophagy
frames.verbose-text: PI3K pan-inhibition induces autophagy which plays a protective role(A) Western blotting demonstrated autophagy activation in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cell lines in response to PI3K inhibition.

frames.text: Autophagy inhibition significantly increased cell death
frames.verbose-text: Autophagy inhibition significantly increased cell death in Loucy, ALL-SIL, and DND-41 cell lines, whereas it did not affect Jurkat cells.

frames.text: PI3K pan-inhibition could induce autophagy
frames.verbose-text: When fold change values are > 1 or < 1, the autophagy-related genes are up- or down-regulated, respectively, compared to untreated samples.Autophagy-related genes analyzed using real-time PCR microarraysAutophagy-related genes up-regulated after PI3K pan-inhibitionThese results demonstrated that PI3K pan-inhibition could induce autophagy which plays a protective role in T-ALL cells, and suggested that autophagy activation in the different T-ALL cell lines might be dependent on a different gene expression regulation.DISCUSSIONPI3K signaling is often deregulated in malignancies and contribute to the oncogenic process.

frames.text: expression of PTEN
frames.verbose-text: Indeed, despite the expression of PTEN protein, we confirmed that in non deleted cells, PTEN was phosphorylated at Ser380 and thus inactivated.

frames.text: PTEN was phosphorylated at Ser380
frames.verbose-text: Indeed, despite the expression of PTEN protein, we confirmed that in non deleted cells, PTEN was phosphorylated at Ser380 and thus inactivated.

frames.text: PI3K pathway activation in T-ALL
frames.verbose-text: This observation underlines the importance of assessing PI3K pathway activation in T-ALL patients rather than just PTEN deletions/mutations, for a better evaluation of patient outcome or possible therapeutic intervention with pathway modulators.

frames.text: PI3K isoforms contribute to its synthesis
frames.verbose-text: We also observed a decrease in total PIP3 levels following inhibition of each PI3K catalytic subunit, suggesting that all the PI3K isoforms contribute to its synthesis in T-ALL cells.

frames.text: PIP3 levels
frames.verbose-text: We also observed a decrease in total PIP3 levels following inhibition of each PI3K catalytic subunit, suggesting that all the PI3K isoforms contribute to its synthesis in T-ALL cells.

frames.text: PIP3 levels
frames.verbose-text: However, inhibitor effects on PIP3 levels did not fully correlate with their cytotoxicity.

frames.text: PI3K inhibition is required to induce cell death
frames.verbose-text: It has been previously reported that a limited PI3K activity is sufficient to support cell survival and proliferation and, consequently, complete PI3K inhibition is required to induce cell death [48].

frames.text: PI3K activity is sufficient to support cell survival
frames.verbose-text: It has been previously reported that a limited PI3K activity is sufficient to support cell survival and proliferation and, consequently, complete PI3K inhibition is required to induce cell death [48].

frames.text: PI3K activity is sufficient to support cell survival and proliferation
frames.verbose-text: It has been previously reported that a limited PI3K activity is sufficient to support cell survival and proliferation and, consequently, complete PI3K inhibition is required to induce cell death [48].

frames.text: FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt
frames.verbose-text: Importantly, PI3K and autophagy pathways are tightly related, as mTORC1 suppress autophagy by inhibiting ULK1, and the transcription factor FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt, regulates a number of autophagy-related genes, including LC3, GABARAPL1, BNIP3, PIK3C3, and ULK1 [35, 55, 56].

frames.text: mTORC1 suppress autophagy
frames.verbose-text: Importantly, PI3K and autophagy pathways are tightly related, as mTORC1 suppress autophagy by inhibiting ULK1, and the transcription factor FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt, regulates a number of autophagy-related genes, including LC3, GABARAPL1, BNIP3, PIK3C3, and ULK1 [35, 55, 56].

frames.text: transcription factor FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt
frames.verbose-text: Importantly, PI3K and autophagy pathways are tightly related, as mTORC1 suppress autophagy by inhibiting ULK1, and the transcription factor FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt, regulates a number of autophagy-related genes, including LC3, GABARAPL1, BNIP3, PIK3C3, and ULK1 [35, 55, 56].

frames.text: mTORC1 suppress autophagy by inhibiting ULK1
frames.verbose-text: Importantly, PI3K and autophagy pathways are tightly related, as mTORC1 suppress autophagy by inhibiting ULK1, and the transcription factor FoxO3, which is inhibited by active Akt, regulates a number of autophagy-related genes, including LC3, GABARAPL1, BNIP3, PIK3C3, and ULK1 [35, 55, 56].

frames.text: cell cycle inhibitor CDKN1B
frames.verbose-text: Conversely, in Jurkat cells, which did not activate autophagy, gene modulation was affected to a much lower extent and preferentially involved anti-proliferative targets, as the cell cycle inhibitor CDKN1B, and the autophagy inhibitor CTSS.

frames.text: PIP3 levels
frames.verbose-text: To detect PIP3 levels, control (DMSO 0.1%) and treated (6 h) cells were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde for 15 min, permeabilized in 0.4% Triton X-100 for 10 min, washed in PSB 1X with 1% BSA and incubated over night at 4Â°C with a FITC-conjugated anti-PIP3 antibody (Echelon Biosciences Inc., Salt Lake City, UT).
